briefdescription.para: applies the PQQ refinement several times on the control mesh pmesh.

detaileddescription.para: The geometry of the refined mesh is computed by the geometry policy mask. This function overwrites the control mesh pmesh with the refined mesh.

parameterdescription.para: an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of pmesh
Type: a class model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<PolygonMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of pmesh.
the number of subdivision steps
Type: unsigned int

briefdescription.para: applies the PTQ refinement several times on the control mesh pmesh.

detaileddescription.para: The geometry of the refined mesh is computed by the geometry policy mask. This function overwrites the control mesh pmesh with the refined mesh.

Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of pmesh.

detaileddescription.para: The geometry of the refined mesh is computed by the geometry policy mask. This function overwrites the control mesh pmesh with the refined mesh.

simplesect.para: pmesh must be a triangle mesh.

briefdescription.para: applies the $ \sqrt{3}$ refinement several times on the control mesh pmesh.

detaileddescription.para: The geometry of the refined mesh is computed by the geometry policy mask. This function overwrites the control mesh pmesh with the refined mesh.

simplesect.para: The border subdivision only happens every second subdivision step during a single call of this function.

parameterdescription.para: an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of pmesh
Type: a class model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<PolygonMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of pmesh.
the number of subdivision steps
Type: unsigned int

simplesect.para: pmesh must be a triangle mesh.

detaileddescription.para: The geometry of the refined mesh is computed by the geometry policy mask CatmullClark_mask_3. This function overwrites the control mesh pmesh with the subdivided mesh.

parameterdescription.para: an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of pmesh.
the number of subdivision steps
Type: unsigned int

briefdescription.para: applies $ \sqrt{3}$-subdivision several times on the control mesh pmesh.

detaileddescription.para: The geometry of the refined mesh is computed by the geometry policy mask Sqrt3_mask_3. This function overwrites the control mesh pmesh with the subdivided mesh.

simplesect.para: The border subdivision only happens every second subdivision step during a single call of this function.

parameterdescription.para: an optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below

listitem.para: a property map associating points to the vertices of pmesh
Type: a class model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<PolygonMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_3 as value type
Extra: If this parameter is omitted, an internal property map for CGAL::vertex_point_t should be available for the vertices of pmesh.
the number of subdivision steps
Type: unsigned int

simplesect.para: pmesh must be a triangle mesh.

briefdescription.para: A subdivision method recursively refines a coarse mesh and generates an ever closer approximation to a smooth surface.

detaileddescription.para: Subdivision_method_3 consists of four subdivision methods and their refinement hosts. Each refinement host is a template function of a polygon mesh class and a geometry policy class. It refines the connectivity of the control mesh and computes the geometry of the refined mesh. The geometry computation is dedicated to the custom geometry policy. A geometry policy consists of functions that compute the new point based on the subdivision stencil. A stencil defines the footprint (a submesh of the control mesh) of a new point.

The four supported refinement hosts are the primal quadrilateral quadrisection (PQQ), the primal triangle quadrisection (PTQ), the dual quadrilateral quadrisection (DQQ), and the $ \sqrt{3}$ triangulation. These refinements are respectively used in Catmull-Clark, Loop, Doo-Sabin and $ \sqrt{3}$ subdivisions.

A refinement host is a template function of a polygon mesh class and a geometry mask class. It refines the input polygon mesh, and computes new points through the geometry masks. Subdivision_method_3 supports four refinement hosts: PQQ, PTQ, DQQ and Sqrt3.
This example program subdivides a polygonal mesh with Catmull-Clark subdivision.
